New non-fiction for February 2015

Written by Brandon King · Published Jan 30, 2015

My dear Bessie: a love story in letters edited by Simon Garfield

Second World War romance crossing continents and years through letters. Their story is a stirring example of the power of letters to transform ordinary lives.

We were eagles. Volume 3, The Eight Air Force at war June 44 to October 44 by Martin Bowman

Story of the pilots who flew the in Eighth Air Force’s campaign over Germany and Occupied Europe during World War Two.

Young Eliot: a biography by Robert Crawford

Major biography tracing the life of T. S. Eliot, from his childhood in the ragtime city of St Louis right up to the publication of his most famous poem, The Waste Land. Drawn from poetry, prose, interviews, archives, and previously undisclosed memoirs.

Sesame & spice: baking from the East End to the Middle East by Anne Shooter

Cinnamon, honey, dates, almonds, apples and pomegranate – these are all flavours that we have grown to love and enjoy and in this book of recipes Suffolk Libraries Bookfest speaker Anne Shooter has created cakes and bakes that celebrate these wonderful traditional ingredients.

Ipswich through time by Caleb Howgego

Fascinating selection of photographs tracing some of the many ways in which Ipswich has changed and developed over the last century.
